results.title: Like it is
results.creator_credit: Paul Oremland, Tracey Gardiner and Channel Four Films
results.brief_description: This low-budget romantic drama marks Paul Oremland’s directorial debut. Craig is a 21 year old boxer from Blackpool, making cash from illegal bare-knuckle fights. A chance meeting outside a club leads him to a brief sexual encounter with Matt, a self-assured disc-jockey from London. He flees the escalating violence of Blackpool and turns up on Matt’s doorstep where he is introduced to the freedom of Soho, an openly gay world he never imagined existed. As the pair become more involved the illusions on which their relationship is built begins to crumble, not helped by Matt’s scheming gay boss (Roger Daltrey) and possessive flatmate, who seek to break them up. Cast includes Steve Bell, Ian Rose and Dani Behr.

results.title: Like it is
results.creator_credit: Tony D'Aquino, Chris Begley, John Brawley and George Nevile
results.brief_description: When an elderly women is forced to have her beloved budgie put down, a vet’s assistant is disturbed by his employer’s unscrupulous practices. A touching short film about human compassion. Cast includes Dylan Lewis, Frank Gallacher and Dawn Klingberg.

results.title: Like drowning
results.brief_description: The story of a little boy’s grief for his mother delicately etched into clay. This simply charming film explores the grief that a young boy, Billy, experiences after losing his mother. All he wants is her back.

results.title: Like drowning
results.creator_credit: Cath Murphy, Paul Fletcher, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A moving animated tale about a young family who try to come to terms with the sudden death of one of the children through drowning. The family struggles to cope and adopt drastic changes in their lifestyle in order to come to terms with the ordeal.

results.title: Like blood
results.creator_credit: Maya Haviland, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Petul is my older sister’s godfather and I am the first woman from my family to visit his grave.’ Maya Haviland’s return to Mexico after eight years made her realise the sense of distance between family members.

results.title: Like any child only more so (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Allan, Maile Ornellas and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Discusses hyperactivity in children. Looks at the definition of hyperactivity, its many possible causes, and methods of treatment. Treatment can include family counselling, special school programs, diets and the use of stimulant like drugs.

results.title: Like any child
results.creator_credit: Gordon Glenn and Cradle Mountain Film Productions for Department of Health and Community Services Specialist Children's Services Unit and The Brotherhood of St Laurence
results.brief_description: Profiles a day in the professional life of two early childhood educators as they include a child with a disability in their centre. We follow their daily routine; seeing how they create a positive environment to encourage interaction between the children and how thoughtful planning enables all children to participate in the program. Accompanied by 3p. Discussion Notes and 47p. training manual entitled “Like any child: planning for children with disabilities.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon Glenn and Cradle Mountain Film Productions for Department of Health and Community Services Specialist Children’s Services Unit and The Brotherhood of St Laurence
